titleStmt.title: A iovrnall of all the proceedings of the duke of Buckingham his grace, in the isle of Ree, a part of France Whereunto is added the names of the French nobilitie that were slaine. Set forth by a gentleman of special note who was a spectator of all that hapned. Published by authoritie.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by A. Mathewes] for Thomas Walkley, and are to be sold at his shop at the Eagle and Childe in Britaines-Bursse,

notesStmt.note: Contains separate title page, with same imprint, reading: A continued iournal of all the proceedings of the duke of Buckingham: his Grace, in the isle of Ree, a part of France. In whom are combined religion, fortitude, and clemencie; being the true characters of a noble generall. Published by authoritie.

Includes: Receiued at Yorke-house. August 15. The relation of Mr. Garetson, master of the shippe called the Bread and Beere-pott of Horne in Holland, made and taken at Plimmouth the 12. of August 1627. by Sit Iames Bagge, knight, who reporteth the same as followeth, with caption title.
A variant, with additions to the title, of STC 24739.5.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
